Verbs.translation: To hit, to play (a hand sport)
To kick, to play (a foot sport)
To be physically able to do something

Measure Words.translation: Measure word for books, booklike objects.
Measure word for cups, glasses, etc.

More Possessives, Family Members.translation: My younger sister is a student.

More Possessives, Family Members.chinese: 他们的弟弟很懒惰，也很笨
More Possessives, Family Members.pinyin: tāmende dìdi hěn lǎnduò, yě hěn bèn.
More Possessives, Family Members.translation: Their younger brother is lazy and stupid.
The teacher’s older sister is pretty.

More Possessives, Family Members.pinyin: nǐmende gǒu hěn kě ài ma?

More Possessives, Family Members.chinese: 你的女朋友是中国人吗？
他的爸爸妈妈很有钱吗？
More Possessives, Family Members.translation: Are his/her mom and dad rich?

More Possessives, Family Members.chinese: 他们的父母是巴西人吗？

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: Yes, I am. I am Chinese.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Bú shì. Wǒ bú shì zhōngguórén.
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: No, I am not. I am not Chinese
Yes, he. He is a teacher.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Bú shì. Tā bú shì lǎoshī.
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: No, he is not. He is not a teacher.
Yes, they are. They are Japanese.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Bú shì. Tāmen bú shì rìběnrén.
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: No, they are not. They are not Japanese.
Yes, she is. My grandmother is a student.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.chinese: 不是,我的外婆不是学生
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Bú shì. Wǒde wàipó bú shì xuéshēng.
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: No, she is not. My grandmother is not a student.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.chinese: 我的妈妈的老公是我的爸爸吗?
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Nǐde māmade lǎogōng shì nǐde bàba ma?
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: Is your mom’s husband your dad?
Yes, he is. He is my dad.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Bú shì. Tā bú shì wǒde bàba.
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: No, he is not. He is not my dad.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Nǐde gǒu shì nǐde péngyǒu ma?

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: Yes, it is. It is my friend.

Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.pinyin: Bú shì. Tā bú shì wǒde péngyǒu.
Yes and No, More Possessives Practice, F.translation: No, it is not. It is not my friend.

Yes or No Questions with Hěn.translation: Yes, he is. He is handsome.
No, he is not. He is not handsome.
No, he is not. He is ugly.
Yes, it is. Canada is big.
No, it is not. Canada is not big.
No, it is not. Canada is small.

WHAT? and Review of This and That.chinese: 那是你的男朋友的狗吗?
WHAT? and Review of This and That.pinyin: nà shì nǐde nánpéngyǒude gǒu ma?

WHAT? and Review of This and That.chinese: 不是,那不是我的男朋友的狗
WHAT? and Review of This and That.pinyin: bú shì. Nà bú shì wǒde nánpéngyǒude gǒu.
WHAT? and Review of This and That.translation: No. That is not my boyfriend’s dog.

WHAT? and Review of This and That.pinyin: bú shì. Nà bú shì gǒu. Nà shì māo.
WHAT? and Review of This and That.translation: No, it is not. That is not a dog. That is a cat.
Yes, it is. This is my toy.
Yes, it is. That is their house.

These and Those.translation: Yes, it is. This is water.

These and Those.pinyin: bú shì. Nà bú shì píngguǒ.
These and Those.translation: No, it is not. That is not an apple.
Yes, they are. These are apples.

These and Those.chinese: 不是，这些不是我的玩具。
These and Those.pinyin: bú shì. Zhèxiē bú shì wǒde wánjù.
These and Those.translation: No, they are not. These are not my toys.
Yes, they are. Those are grapes.

These and Those.pinyin: bú shì. Nàxiē bú shì lǎohú.
These and Those.translation: No, they are not. Those are not tigers.

Who? And Review of These and Those.translation: Yes, it is. This is (a) watermelon.
No, it is not. That is a cow.

Who? And Review of These and Those.pinyin: bú shì. Zhèxiē bú shì jī.
Who? And Review of These and Those.translation: No, they are not. These are not chickens.
Yes, they are. Those are strawberries.

Who? And Review of These and Those.chinese: 这些是我的老师的葡萄。
那些是我的外婆的蓝莓。
这是你的妈妈的房子吗？
Who? And Review of These and Those.pinyin: zhè shì nǐde māmade fángzi ma?

Who? And Review of These and Those.chinese: 是，这是我的妈妈的房子。
Who? And Review of These and Those.pinyin: shì. Zhè shì wǒde māmade fángzi.
Who? And Review of These and Those.translation: Yes, it is. This is my mom’s house.
Yes, it is. That is their rabbit.

Who? And Review of These and Those.chinese: 那些是你的朋友的 柠檬。

Numbers and Days of the Week.translation: The day after tomorrow is Friday.
The day before yesterday was Monday.
Yesterday my older sister was (very) happy.
Yes, I was. I was bored yesterday.

Months of the Year.chinese: 你的哥哥的生日是几月？
Months of the Year.translation: What month is your older brother’s birthday?

Months of the Year.chinese: 我的哥哥的生日是二月。
Months of the Year.translation: My older brother’s birthday is in February.

Months of the Year.chinese: 你的弟弟的生日是五月吗？
Months of the Year.pinyin: nǐde dìdide shēngrì shì wǔyuè ma?
Months of the Year.translation: Is your younger brother’s birthday in May?

Months of the Year.chinese: 是，我的弟弟的生日是五月。
Months of the Year.pinyin: shì. Wǒde dìdide shēngrì shì wǔyuè.
Months of the Year.translation: Yes, it is. My younger brother’s birthday is in May.

Months of the Year.chinese: 我们的妈妈的生日是九月吗？
Months of the Year.pinyin: wǒmende māmade shēngrì shì jiǔyuè ma?
Months of the Year.translation: Is our mom’s birthday in September?

Months of the Year.chinese: 不是，我们的妈妈的生日不是九月。
Months of the Year.pinyin: bú shì. wǒmende māmade shēngrì bú shì jiǔyuè.
Months of the Year.translation: No, our mom’s birthday is not in September.

Months of the Year.chinese: 我们的妈妈的生日是十一月。
Months of the Year.translation: Our mom’s birthday is in November.

What Time Is It?.translation: It is half-past eight; it is 8:30

What Time Is It?.chinese: 是，现在 是 两点。
现在 是 十一点吗？
不是，现在 是 九点。
What Time Is It?.pinyin: bú shì. Xiànzài shì jiǔ diǎn.

More Review of Shi and Hen.translation: My mom and dad are not thirsty.
Yes, I am. I am busy.

More Review of Shi and Hen.pinyin: bú shì. Wo bù ǎi. Wǒ hěn gāo.
More Review of Shi and Hen.translation: No, I am not. I am not short. I am tall.
No, she is not. She is ugly.

More Review of Shi and Hen.pinyin: bú shì. Tā shì xuéshēng. Tā hěn máng.
More Review of Shi and Hen.translation: No, she is not. She is a student. She is very busy.
No, it is not. Canada is big.
No, it is not. Taiwan is not big.
Yes, it is. It is cute.

Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.chinese: 你的老师的电话号码是什么？
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.pinyin: nǐde lǎoshīde diànhuà hàomǎ shì shénme?
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.translation: What is your teacher’s telephone number?

Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.chinese: 我的老师的电话号码是4029533。

Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.pinyin: wéi. Nǐ hǎo. Nǐ shì shéi?
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.translation: Hello #1 (to answer phone. Hello #2 (to greet). Who are you?

Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.pinyin: shì. Wǒde míngzi shì Mike. Nǐ hǎo.
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.translation: Yes, it is. My name is Mike. Hello.

Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.pinyin: bú shì. Wǒ shì měiguórén. Nǐ ne?
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.translation: No, I am not. I am American. And you?

Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.chinese: 我是中国人。我的名字是艾米。我很累。
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.pinyin: wǒ shì zhōngguórén. Wǒde míngzi shì Àimǐ. Wǒ hěn lèi.
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.translation: I am Chinese. My name is Amy. I am very tired.

Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.pinyin: wǒ yě hěn lèi. Nǐ hěn máng ma?
Big Numbers and Phone Numbers.translation: I am tired, too. Are you busy?
What day was the day before yesterday?
The day before yesterday was Wednesday.
What day is the day after tomorrow?
The day after tomorrow is Sunday.
What time is it? Note: It is not necessary to say “shì”or “zhōng”
Note: It is not necessary to say “shì” or “zhōng” (It’s more formal)
What time is it? (lit. How many hours, how many minutes)
It is 6:43. (lit. There are 6 hours and 43 minutes)

How Old Are You?.translation: How old is your younger sister?
My younger sister is 13 years old.
Their daughter is two years old.
Chinese New Year is what month and day?
Chinese New Year is in February.
Christmas is what month and day?

How Old Are You?.chinese: 圣诞节是十二月二十五号。

How Old Are You?.translation: Valentine's Day is what month and day?

Here, There, and Where.translation: This year I am 30 years old.
Next year my wife will be 55 years old.
Last year my son was 4 years old.
Where are you? (lit. You at where?)

Here, There, and Where.pinyin: yùmǐ hěn tián, yě hěn piányí.
Here, There, and Where.translation: The corn is sweet and also cheap.

Here, There, and Where.pinyin: tǔdòu hěn dà, yě hěn yìng.
Here, There, and Where.translation: The potato is big and also hard.

Places.translation: My friend is at the museum.
He is at the movie theater.
Yes, I am. I am at the restaurant.

Places.chinese: 他们的母亲在图书馆吗？
Places.translation: Is their mother at the library?

Places.chinese: 不是，他们的母亲在动物园。
Places.pinyin: bú shì. Tāmende mǔqīn zài dòngwùyuán.
Places.translation: No, she is not. Their mother is at the zoo.

Places.chinese: Mike老师的女朋友在美术馆吗？
Places.pinyin: Mike lǎoshīde nǚpéngyǒu zài měishùguǎn ma?
Places.translation: Is Teacher Mike’s girlfriend at the art museum?
Yes, she is. She is at the art museum.
No, it is not. Tokyo is in Japan.
Yes, it is. Berlin is in Germany.
Yes, it is. Paris is in France.
What country is Moscow in? （lit. Moscow in what country?)

Rooms and Objects of the House.translation: Where are you?
I am at home.
Where are you guys?
We are in the kitchen.
Is your father in the study?
Yes, he is. He is in the study.
Where is your car?
My car is in the garage.
Where is the teacher’s book?
The teacher’s book is in the study.
Where is the student’s mom?
She is in the living room.

Rooms and Objects of the House.pinyin: Geoff de tàitai zài fàntīng ma?
Rooms and Objects of the House.translation: Is Geoff’s wife in the dining room?

Rooms and Objects of the House.pinyin: bú shì. Geoff de tàitài zài yùshì.
Rooms and Objects of the House.translation: No, she isn’t. Geoff’s wife is in the bathroom.
Where is your house?
My house is in Chicago.
Where is the computer?
The computer is in the study.
Is the refrigerator in the living room?
No, it isn’t. The refrigerator is in the kitchen.
Where is the sofa?
The sofa is in the living room.
Is the TV in your bedroom?
No, it isn’t. The TV is in the living room.
Is the bed in your bedroom?
Yes, it is. The bed is in my bedroom.
Is your bed soft?
Yes, it is. My bed is (very) soft.

Rooms and Objects of the House.chinese: 你的外婆的电话很贵吗？
Rooms and Objects of the House.pinyin: nǐde wàipóde diànhuà hěn guì ma?
Rooms and Objects of the House.translation: Is your grandmother’s telephone expensive?

Rooms and Objects of the House.chinese: 是。我的外婆的电话很贵。
Rooms and Objects of the House.pinyin: shì. Wǒde wàipóde diànhuà hěn guì.
Rooms and Objects of the House.translation: Yes, it is. My grandmother’s telephone is expensive.

Rooms and Objects of the House.pinyin: Mike lǎoshīde jìngzi hěn gānjìng ma?
Rooms and Objects of the House.translation: Is Teacher Mike’s mirror clean?

Rooms and Objects of the House.chinese: 不是。Mike老师的镜子很脏，也很久。
Rooms and Objects of the House.pinyin: bú shì. Mike lǎoshīde jìngzi hěn zāng, yě hěn jiù.
Rooms and Objects of the House.translation: No, it isn’t. Teacher Mike’s mirror is dirty and old.

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: Where are you from/What is your nationality? (lit. You are where person?)

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: nǐde xiānshēng shì nǎ lǐ rén?
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: Where is your husband’s nationality?/Where is he from?

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: Mikede péngyǒu shì nǎ lǐ rén?
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: What is Mike’s friend’s nationality? Where is Mike’s friend from?

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: tāmende lǎoshī shì nǎ lǐ rén?
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: What is their teacher’s nationality?/Where is their teacher from?

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.chinese: 你的弟弟的太太是哪里人？
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: nǐde dìdi de tàitài shì nǎ lǐ rén?
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: Where is your younger brother’s wife from?
Yes, it is. The weather is good.

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.chinese: 我的姐姐是很瘦的女人。
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: wǒde jiějie shì hěn shòude nǚrén.
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: My older sister is a thin woman.

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.chinese: Mike老师的妹妹是很懒惰的学生。
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: Mike lǎoshīde mèimei shì hěn lǎnduòde xuéshēng.
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: Teacher Mike’s younger sister is a lazy student.

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.chinese: 他们的爸爸是很有钱的人吗？
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: tāmende bàba shì hěn yǒuqiánde rén ma?
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: Is their dad a rich person?

Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.chinese: 不是。他们的爸爸是很穷的人。
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.pinyin: bú shì. tāmende bàba shì hěn qióngde rén.
Nationalities, Weather, and Adjectives.translation: No, he’s not. Their dad is a poor person.

More Adjective-Noun Combos.translation: This is a very interesting museum.

More Adjective-Noun Combos.pinyin: tā shì hěn piàoliàngde nǚrén ma?
shì. Tā shì hěn piàoliàngde nǚrén.
More Adjective-Noun Combos.translation: Yes, she is. She is a beautiful woman.

More Adjective-Noun Combos.chinese: 你的哥哥是很聪明的人吗？
More Adjective-Noun Combos.pinyin: nǐde gēge shì hěn cōngmíngde rén ma?
More Adjective-Noun Combos.translation: Is your older brother a smart person?

More Adjective-Noun Combos.chinese: 不是。我的哥哥是很笨的人。
More Adjective-Noun Combos.pinyin: bú shì. Wǒde gēge shì hěn bènde rén.
More Adjective-Noun Combos.translation: No, he isn’t. My older brother is a stupid person.

More Adjective-Noun Combos.pinyin: zhè shì hěn tiánde chéngzi ma?
shì. Zhè shì hěn tiánde chéngzi.
More Adjective-Noun Combos.translation: Yes, it is. This is a sweet orange.

More Adjective-Noun Combos.pinyin: nà shì hěn yǒuqùde shū ma?
shì. Nà shì hěn yǒuqùde shū.
More Adjective-Noun Combos.translation: Yes, it is. That is an interesting book.

Why and Because.chinese: 他很聪明。为什么？因为他是老师。
Why and Because.pinyin: tā hěn cōngmíng. wèishénme? yīnwèi tā shì lǎoshī.
Why and Because.translation: He is intelligent. Why? Because he is a teacher.

Why and Because.chinese: 我的阿姨在中国。为什么？因为她是中国人。
Why and Because.pinyin: wǒde āyí zài zhōngguó. wèishénme? yīnwèi tā shì zhōngguórén.
Why and Because.translation: My aunt is in China. Why? Because she is Chinese (a Chinese person.)

Why and Because.chinese: 我很生气。为什么？因为我的小孩很顽皮。
Why and Because.pinyin: wǒ hěn shēngqì. wèishénme? yīnwèi wǒde xiǎohái hěn wánpí.
Why and Because.translation: I am angry. Why? Because my child(ren) are naughty.

Why and Because.chinese: 今天你好吗？今天我不好。为什么？因为天气很冷。
Why and Because.pinyin: jīntiān nǐ hǎo ma? jīntiān wǒ bù hǎo. Wèishénme? Yīnwèi tiānqì hěn lěng.
Why and Because.translation: How are you today? I am not well today. Why? Because the weather is cold.

Why and Because.chinese: 你的狗在你的家吗？不是。为什么？因为它在我的朋友的家。
Why and Because.pinyin: nǐde gǒu zài nǐde jiā ma? Bú shì. wèishénme? Yīnwèi tā zài wǒde péngyǒude jiā.
Why and Because.translation: Is your dog at your house? No, it is not. Why? Because it is at my friend’s house.

Why and Because.chinese: 她在学校。为什么？因为她是学生。
Why and Because.pinyin: tā zài xuéxiào. wèishénme? yīnwèi tā shì xuéshēng.
Why and Because.translation: She is at school. Why? Because she is a student.

Why and Because.chinese: 他很有钱。为什么？因为他是律师。
Why and Because.pinyin: tā hěn yǒuqián. wèishénme? yīnwèi tā shì lǜshī.
Why and Because.translation: He is rich. Why? Because he is a lawyer.

Why and Because.chinese: 我的房子很小。为什么？因为我很穷。
Why and Because.pinyin: wǒde fángzi hěn xiǎo. wèishénme? yīnwèi wǒ hěn qióng.
Why and Because.translation: My house is small. Why? Because I am poor.

Why and Because.chinese: 我的房子很贵。为什么？因为我很有钱。
Why and Because.pinyin: wǒde fángzi hěn guì. wèishénme? yīnwèi wǒ hěn yǒuqián.
Why and Because.translation: My house is expensive. Why? Because I am rich.

Why and Because.chinese: 她在医院。为什么？因为她是护士。
Why and Because.pinyin: tā zài yīyuàn. wèishénme? yīnwèi tā shì hùshì.
Why and Because.translation: She is at the hospital. Why? Because she is a nurse.

The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.chinese: 我们的妈妈很矮，也很老。
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.pinyin: wǒmende māma hěn ǎi, yě hěn lǎo.
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.translation: Our mom is short and old.
My older sister’s hair is short.

The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.chinese: 你的男朋友的头发很长吗？
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.pinyin: nǐde nánpéngyǒude tóufǎ hěn cháng ma?
bú shì. Tāde tóufǎ hěn duǎn.
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.translation: No, it is not. His hair is short.

The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.pinyin: Mike Lǎoshīde tuǐ hěn cháng ma?

The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.translation: Yes, they are. His legs are long.

The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.chinese: 为什么你的爸爸的腿很长？
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.pinyin: wèishénme nǐde bàbade tuǐ hěn cháng?
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.translation: Why are your dad’s legs long?
Yes, it does. My stomach hurts.
Is your daughter in good health/healthy?

The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.chinese: 是。我的女儿的身体很好。谢谢。
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.pinyin: shì. Wǒde nǚ'érde shēntǐ hěn hǎo. Xièxie.
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.translation: Yes, she is. My daughter is in good health/healthy.

The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.pinyin: bú shì. Wǒde shǒu hěn zāng.
The Return to Mike’s Garage and Body Par.translation: No, they are not. My hands are dirty.

Colors.chinese: 不是。这不是蓝色的车子。
Colors.pinyin: bú shì. Zhè bú shì lánsède chēzi.
Colors.translation: No, it is not. This is not a blue car.
Yes, it is. That is a black shoe.

Colors.chinese: 不是。那些不是黑色的鞋子。
Colors.pinyin: bú shì. Nàxiē bú shì hēisède xiézi.
Colors.translation: No, they are not. Those are not black shoes.

Colors.chinese: 你的蓝色的车子在哪里？
Colors.pinyin: nǐde lánsède chēzi zài nǎ lǐ?

Colors.chinese: 我的蓝色的车子在这里。
Colors.pinyin: wǒde lánsède chēzi zài zhè lǐ.

Colors.chinese: 我的爸爸的绿色的球在哪里？
Colors.pinyin: wǒde bàbade lǜsède qiú zài nǎ lǐ?
Colors.translation: Where is my dad’s green ball?
His green ball is in the kitchen.

So.chinese: 我不舒服。为什么？因为我的家很冷。
So.pinyin: wǒ bù shūfú. Wèishénme? Yīnwèi wǒde jiā hěn lěng.
So.translation: I am uncomfortable. Why? Because my house is cold.

So.chinese: 他很有钱。为什么？因为他是商人。
So.pinyin: tā hěn yǒuqián. Wèishénme? Yīnwèi tā shì shāngrén.
So.translation: He is rich. Why? Because he is a businessman.

So.chinese: 我很难过。为什么？因为我的太太不在这里。
So.pinyin: wǒ hěn nánguò. Wèishénme? Yīnwèi wǒde tàitai bú zài zhè lǐ.
So.translation: I am sad. Why? Because my wife is not here.

So.chinese: 他们的妈妈很生气。为什么？因为他们很顽皮。
So.pinyin: tāmende māma hěn shēngqì. Wèishénme? Yīnwèi tāmen hěn wánpí.
So.translation: Their mom is angry. Why? Because they are very naughty.

So.chinese: 因为你是医生，所以你很聪明。
So.pinyin: yīnwèi nǐ shì yīshēng, suǒyǐ nǐ hěn cōngmíng.
So.translation: Because you are a doctor, you are very intelligent.

So.chinese: 因为我很穷，所以我的房子很小。
So.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒ hěn qióng, suǒyǐ wǒde fángzi hěn xiǎo.
So.translation: Because I am poor, my house is small.

So.chinese: 因为天气很热，所以农民很辛苦。
So.pinyin: yīnwèi tiānqì hěn rè, suǒyǐ nóngmín hěn xīnkǔ.
So.translation: Because the weather is hot, the farmer is very hard-working/tired.

So.chinese: 因为你的老公很不好，所以你很伤心。
So.pinyin: yīnwèi nǐde lǎogōng hěn bù hǎo, suǒyǐ nǐ hěn shāngxīn.
So.translation: Because your husband is very bad, you are very sad.

So.chinese: 因为她是军人，所以她很壮。
So.pinyin: yīnwèi tā shì jūnrén, suǒyǐ tā hěn zhuàng.
So.translation: Because she is a soldier, she is strong.

So.chinese: 你的爸爸是警察吗？是。他是警察。
So.pinyin: nǐde bàba shì jǐngchá ma? Shì. Tā shì jǐngchá.
So.translation: Is your dad a police officer? Yes, he is. He is a police officer.

So.chinese: 你的老婆的妈妈是秘书吗？不是。他是老师。
So.pinyin: nǐde lǎopóde māma shì mìshū ma? Bú shì. Tā shì lǎoshī.
So.translation: Is your wife’s mom a secretary? No, she is not. She is a teacher.

So.chinese: 因为今天是我的生日，所以我很高兴。
So.pinyin: yīnwèi jīntiān shì wǒde shēngrì, suǒyǐ wǒ hěn gāoxìng.
So.translation: Because today is my birthday, I am very happy.

So.chinese: 因为明天是我的女儿的生日，所以她很兴奋。
So.pinyin: yīnwèi míngtiān shì wǒde nǚ'érde shēngrì, suǒyǐ tā hěn xīngfèn.
So.translation: Because tomorrow is my daughter’s birthday, she is very excited.

Review of So and But.chinese: 因为现在是夏天，所以天气很热。
Review of So and But.pinyin: yīnwèi xiànzài shì xiàtiān, suǒyǐ tiānqì hěn rè.
Review of So and But.translation: Because it is summer, the weather is hot.

Review of So and But.chinese: 因为现在是冬天，所以天气很冷。
Review of So and But.pinyin: yīnwèi xiànzài shì dōngtiān, suǒyǐ tiānqì hěn lěng.
Review of So and But.translation: Because it is winter, the weather is cold.

Review of So and But.chinese: 因为我的牙齿很痛，所以我不舒服。
Review of So and But.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒde yáchǐ hěn tòng, suǒyǐ wǒ bù shūfú.
Review of So and But.translation: Because my teeth hurt, I am uncomfortable.

Review of So and But.chinese: 因为我的老婆很丑，所以我很难过。
Review of So and But.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒde lǎopó hěn chǒu, suǒyǐ wǒ hěn nánguò.
Review of So and But.translation: Because my wife is ugly, I am sad.

Review of So and But.chinese: 因为我的老婆很漂亮，所以我很高兴。
Review of So and But.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒde lǎopó hěn piàoliàng, suǒyǐ wǒ hěn gāoxìng.
Review of So and But.translation: Because my wife is beautiful, I am happy.

Review of So and But.chinese: 因为我的儿子很乖，所以我很高兴。
Review of So and But.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒde érzi hěn guāi, suǒyǐ wǒ hěn gāoxìng.
Review of So and But.translation: Because my son is well-behaved, I am happy.

Review of So and But.chinese: 我很高但是我的父母不高。
Review of So and But.pinyin: wǒ hěn gāo dànshì wǒde fùmǔ bù gāo.
Review of So and But.translation: I am tall, but my parents are not tall.

Review of So and But.chinese: 你很帅但是你的女朋友很丑。
Review of So and But.pinyin: nǐ hěn shuài dànshì nǐde nǚpéngyǒu hěn chǒu.
Review of So and But.translation: You are handsome, but your girlfriend is ugly.

Review of So and But.chinese: 我的儿子很乖但是我的女儿很顽皮。
Review of So and But.pinyin: wǒde érzi hěn guāi dànshì wǒde nǚ'ér hěn wánpí.
Review of So and But.translation: My son is well-behaved, but my daughter is naughty.

Review of So and But.chinese: 医生很有钱但是她很忙。
Review of So and But.pinyin: yīshēng hěn yǒuqián dànshì tā hěn máng.
Review of So and But.translation: The doctor is rich, but she is busy.

Review of So and But.chinese: 我的狗很小但是他很壮。
Review of So and But.pinyin: wǒde gǒu hěn xiǎo dànshì tā hěn zhuàng.
Review of So and But.translation: My dog is very small, but it is strong.

Review of So and But.chinese: 我的老师很好但是他很严格。
Review of So and But.pinyin: wǒde lǎoshī hěn hǎo dànshì tā hěn yángé.
Review of So and But.translation: My teacher is very good, but he is strict.

Review of So and But.chinese: 现在是冬天吗？是。现在是冬天。
Review of So and But.pinyin: xiànzài shì dōngtiān ma? Shì. Xiànzài shì dōngtiān.
Review of So and But.translation: Is it winter now? Yes, it is. It is winter.

Review of So and But.chinese: 现在是夏天吗？不是。现在是秋天。
Review of So and But.pinyin: xiànzài shì xiàtiān ma? Bú shì. Xiànzài shì qiūtiān.
Review of So and But.translation: Is it summer now? No, it is not. It is fall.

Review of So and But.chinese: 你的儿子是消防员吗？是。他是消防员。
Review of So and But.pinyin: nǐde érzi shì xiāofángyuán ma? Shì. Tā shì xiāofángyuán.
Review of So and But.translation: Is your son a firefighter? Yes, he is. He is a firefighter.

Review of So and But.pinyin: tā sān suì dànshì tā hěn cōngmíng.
Review of So and But.translation: He is three years old, but he is very smart.

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: nǐ shì Mike Lǎoshī ma?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Are you Teacher Mike?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: nǐ shì bú shì Mike Lǎoshī?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Are you or are you not Teacher Mike?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tā shì nǐde bàba ma?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Is he your dad?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tā shì bú shì nǐde bàba?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Is he or is he not your dad?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tāmen shì táiwānrén ma?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Are they Taiwanese?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tāmen shì bú shì táiwānrén?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Are they or are they not Taiwanese?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: nǐ shì bú shì zhōngguórén?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Are you Chinese?

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 是。我是中国人。你呢？你是不是中国人？
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: shì. wǒ shì zhōngguórén. nǐ ne? nǐ shì bú shì zhōngguórén?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Yes. I am Chinese. And you? Are you Chinese?

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 不是。我不是中国人。我是法国人。
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: bú shì. Wǒ bú shì zhōngguórén. wǒ shì fǎguórén.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: No, I am not. I am not Chinese. I am French.

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tā shì bú shì lǜshī?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Is she a lawyer?

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 是。她是律师。因为她是律师所以她很有钱。
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: shì. tā shì lǜshī. yīnwèi tā shì lǜshī suǒyǐ tā hěn yǒuqián.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Yes, she is a lawyer. Because she is a lawyer, she is rich.

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 你的男朋友是不是教书？
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: nǐde nánpéngyǒu shì bú shì jiàoshòu?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Is your boyfriend a professor?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: shì. tā shì jiàoshòu
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Yes, he is. He is a professor.

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tāde dàxué zài nǎ lǐ?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Where is his university?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tāde dàxué zài měiguó.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: His university is in America.

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tāmen shì bú shì yīshēng?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Are they doctors?

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 不是。他们是护士。现在他们在医院。
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: bú shì. tāmen shì hùshì. xiànzài tāmen zài yīyuàn.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: No, they aren’t. They are nurses. They are at the hospital now.

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: nǐmen shì bú shì xuéshēng?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Are you students?

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: shì. wǒmen shì xuéshēng.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Yes, we are. We are students.

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: jīntiān shì bú shì nǐde shēngrì?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Is today your birthday?

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 不是。明天是我的生日。我十三岁。
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: bú shì. míngtiān shì wǒde shēngrì. Wǒ shísān suì.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: No, it isn’t. Tomorrow is my birthday. I’m 13 years old.

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 你的名字是不是王建明？
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: nǐde míngzi shì bú shì Wáng Jiàn Míng?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Is your name Jian Ming Wang? *family names come first in Chinese

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: bú shì. wǒde míngzi shì Mike lǎoshī.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: No, it is not. My name is Teacher Mike.

Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: tā shì bú shì nǐde péngyǒu?
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Is he your friend?

Another Way to Ask Questions.chinese: 是。他是我的朋友。他很聪明。
Another Way to Ask Questions.pinyin: shì. tā shì wǒde péngyǒu. tā hěn cōngmíng.
Another Way to Ask Questions.translation: Yes, he is. He is my friend. He is smart.

Goodbye... for now.pinyin: nǐde péngyǒude māo chǒu bù chǒu?
Michael Jordan yǒu bù yǒu míng?

Yao.translation: Do you want coffee or beer?

Yao.chinese: 我的朋友要可乐还是果汁
Yao.pinyin: wǒde péngyǒu yào kělè háishì guǒzhī?
Yao.translation: Does our friend want cola or fruit juice?

Eat and Drink.translation: I want to eat fried rice
You want to eat fried noodles
You guys want to drink tea

Eat and Drink.pinyin: wǒde nǚ péngyǒu yào chī jī ròu
Eat and Drink.translation: My girlfriend wants to eat chicken

Eat and Drink.chinese: 我的妹妹要吃牛肉炒饭
Eat and Drink.pinyin: wǒde mèimei yào chī niúròu chǎo fàn
Eat and Drink.translation: My younger sister wants to eat been fried rice
Do you want to drink Cola?

Eat and Drink.pinyin: nǐ dí gēgē yào chī jī ròu ma?
Eat and Drink.translation: Does your older brother want to eat chicken?

Eat and Drink.chinese: 他们的老师要喝牛奶吗？
Eat and Drink.pinyin: tāmen de lǎoshī yào hē niúnǎi ma?
Eat and Drink.translation: Does their teacher want to drink milk?

Eat and Drink.pinyin: wǒmen de bà ba yào chīfàn
Eat and Drink.translation: Our father wants to eat (a meal).

Eat and Drink.chinese: 我的姐姐的男朋友要喝茶
Eat and Drink.pinyin: wǒde jiejie de nán péngyǒu yào hē chá
Eat and Drink.translation: My older sister's boyfriend wants to drink tea
Do you guys want to eat noodles?
My mother wants to drink soup.

Kan.translation: Do you want to watch TV? (alternate 1)
Do you want to watch TV? (alternate 2)
Yes. I want to watch TV.
No. I don't want to watch TV.

Kan.pinyin: nǐde dìdì yào kàn diànyǐng ma?
Kan.translation: Does your younger brother want to watch a movie? (alternate 1)

Kan.chinese: 你的弟弟要不要看电影？
Kan.pinyin: nǐde dìdì yào búyào kàn diànyǐng?
Kan.translation: Does your younger brother want to watch a movie? (alternate 2)
Does she want to read a book?
No. She doesn't want to read a book.
Does he want to read a magazine?
Yes. He wants to read a magazine.
Do you want to watch a DVD?
No. I don't want to watch a DVD.

Kan.chinese: 你的太太要不要看报纸？
Kan.pinyin: nǐde tàitài yào búyào kàn bàozhǐ?
Kan.translation: Does your wife want to read a newspaper?

Kan.pinyin: yào. wǒde tàitài yào kàn bàozhǐ.
Kan.translation: Yes. My wife wants to read a newspaper.

Shuo vs. Jiang.pinyin: nǐ huì bú huì shuō Zhōngwén?
bú huì. wǒ bú huì shuō Zhōngwén.
nǐde xiānshēng huì jiǎng Yīngwén ma?

Shuo vs. Jiang.chinese: 你的先生会不会讲英文？
Shuo vs. Jiang.pinyin: nǐde xiānshēng huì bú huì jiǎng Yīngwén?
wǒ bú huì jiǎng Rì wén
nǐ huì bú huì shuō Yīngwén?
tāmen huì bú huì shuō Zhōngwén?
Mike lǎoshī huì bú huì shuō Yīngwén?
Zhōngguó rén huì shuō Zhōngwén ma?

What Can You Do?.pinyin: nǐde tàitài huì zhǔ fàn ma?
wǒde lǎoshī huì xiě Zhōngwén zì
What Can You Do?.translation: My Teacher can write Chinese characters.

What Can You Do?.pinyin: wǒde érzi yě bú huì kāichē
tā yào búyào chī chǎo fàn?
What Can You Do?.translation: Does she want to eat fried rice? (alternate 1)

What Can You Do?.pinyin: tā yào chī chǎo fàn ma?
What Can You Do?.translation: Does she want to eat fried rice? (alternate 2)

What Can You Do?.pinyin: tāmen huì bú huì shuō zhōngwén?

More Yao, More Hui.translation: Do you want to listen to music?
Yes. I want to listen to music.

More Yao, More Hui.pinyin: bú huì. tā bú huì yòng kuàizi

More Yao, More Hui.chinese: 你的弟弟会不会骑摩托车？
More Yao, More Hui.pinyin: nǐde dìdì huì bú huì qí mótuō chē?
More Yao, More Hui.translation: Can your brother ride a motorcyle?

More Yao, More Hui.pinyin: huì. tā huì qí mótuō chē
More Yao, More Hui.translation: Yes. He can ride a motorcycle.
My knife is in the kitchen.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do (lit. enter border follow custom)
Does your wife want to ride a horse?
No. She doesn't want to ride a horse.

More Yao, More Hui.chinese: 为什么？因为他不会骑马
More Yao, More Hui.pinyin: wèishénme? yīnwèi tā bú huì qí mǎ
More Yao, More Hui.translation: Because she can't ride a horse.

More Yao, More Hui.chinese: 你的朋友要听中文歌吗？
More Yao, More Hui.pinyin: nǐde péngyǒu yào tīng Zhōngwén gē ma?
More Yao, More Hui.translation: Does your friend want to listen to Chinese music?

More Yao, More Hui.pinyin: bùyào. Tā yào tīng Yīngwén gē
More Yao, More Hui.translation: No. She want to listen to English music.

Haochi ma?.translation: Is your book a good read?
My book is a good read
Is your newspaper a good read?
Good read/good read/not a good read

Haochi ma?.chinese: 你的鸡肉炒饭好不好吃？
Haochi ma?.pinyin: nǐde jī ròu chǎo fàn hǎobù hǎo chī?
Haochi ma?.translation: Is your chicken fried rice tasty?

Haochi ma?.pinyin: nǐde chòu dòufu hǎobù hǎo chī?

To Like.translation: I like you/ don't like you
Geoff likes to listen to music
Does Geoff like to listen to music?

To Like.pinyin: Geoff xǐ bù xǐhuan tīng yīnyuè?
To Like.translation: Does Geoff like to listen to music?

Sports.translation: Do you like to play basketball?

Sports.pinyin: tā xǐ bù xǐhuan tī zúqiú?
Sports.translation: Does he like to play soccer?
Does the teacher like to play baseball?
The teacher doesn't like playing baseball.

Sports.chinese: 我的爸爸的朋友不喜欢我
Sports.pinyin: wǒde bà ba de péngyǒu bù xǐhuan wǒ
Sports.translation: My dad's friend doesn't like me

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: I want cola

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: nǐ yào bú yào mǎi qìqiú?
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: Do you want to buy a balloon?
He wants to buy a toy.

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 我的姐姐要卖她的车子
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: wǒde jiějie yào mài tāde chēzi.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: My sister wants to sell her car.

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 老师的朋友不要不要买篮球。他要买排球
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: Lǎoshīde péngyǒu bú yào mǎi lánqiú. Tā yào mǎi páiqiú.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: Teacher's friend don't want to buy a basketball. He is looking for a volleyball.
You want to sell something?
I want to sell my chair.
Why?
Because my chair is old.
Who wants to buy ice cream?

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 他们要买冰淇淋。冰淇淋很好吃。
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: tāmen yào mǎi bīngqílín. Bīngqílín hěn hǎochī.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: They want to buy ice cream. Ice cream is good to eat.
I want to buy a Chinese book.
Can you speak Chinese?
Yes. I can speak Chinese.

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 我的妹妹要卖她的法文书。
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: wǒde mèimei yào mài tāde Fǎwén shū.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: My youger sister wants to sell her French books.

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 因为她的法文书不好看。她要买新的法文书。
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: Yīnwèi tāde Fǎwén shū bù hǎokàn. Tā yào mǎi xīnde Fǎwén shū.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: Because her French books are not good to read. She wants to buy new French books.
I like buying things.
My daughter wants to buy candy.
My son wants to buy some too.

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 因为我很饿，所以我要买晚餐。
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: yīnwèi wǒ hěn è, suǒyǐ wǒ yào mǎi wǎncān.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: Because I am hungry, I want to buy dinner.

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 因为我们很渴，所以我们要买饮料。
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: yīnwèi wǒmen hěn kě, suǒyǐ wǒmen yào mǎi yǐnliào.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: Because we are thirsty, we want to buy drinks.

Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).chinese: 我要买电脑。但是电脑很贵。
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).pinyin: wǒ yào mǎi diànnǎo. Dànshì diànnǎo hěn guì.
Mǎi and Mài (Buy & sell).translation: I want to buy a computer, but the computer is expensive.

How Much Is It?.translation: I want to buy orange juice

How Much Is It?.pinyin: nǐ yào dà de háishì xiǎo de
How Much Is It?.translation: Do you want a large or small?

How Much Is It?.pinyin: wǒ yào dà de. Duōshǎo qián?
How Much Is It?.translation: I want a large. How much is it?

How Much Is It?.pinyin: wǒ yào mài wǒ de shǒujī
How Much Is It?.translation: I want to sell my cellphone

Clothes.translation: What do you want to wear?

Clothes.pinyin: wǒ yào chuān lǜsè de chènshān
Clothes.translation: I want to wear a green shirt

Clothes.pinyin: jīntiān tā yào chuān shénme yīfú?
Clothes.translation: What does he want to wear today?
Do you want to wear shoes?
What colour shoes do you want to wear?

Clothes.pinyin: wǒ yào chuān hēisè de xiézi
Clothes.translation: I want to wear black shoes

Clothes.pinyin: wǒ de xié zé hǎobù hǎokàn?

More Verbs.chinese: 我在大学。我要学习日文
More Verbs.pinyin: wǒ zài dàxué. Wǒ yào xuéxí rìwén
More Verbs.translation: I am at University. I want to study Japanese

More Verbs.chinese: 因为我的英文不好，所以我要练习
More Verbs.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒ de yīngwén bù hǎo, suǒyǐ wǒ yào liànxí
More Verbs.translation: Because my English is bad, I want to practice.

To Go.translation: I like to go to the park.
Do you like to go to the park?
Do you like to go to the zoo?
Yes. I like to go to the zoo.

To Go.pinyin: tā xǐ bù xǐhuan qù yīyuàn?
To Go.translation: Does he like to go to the hospital?

To Go.chinese: 不喜欢。他不喜欢去医院
To Go.pinyin: bù xǐhuan. Tā bù xǐhuan qù yīyuàn
To Go.translation: No. He doesn't like to go to the hospital.

To Go.chinese: 我喜欢去电影院看新电影
To Go.pinyin: wǒ xǐhuan qù diànyǐngyuàn kàn xīn diànyǐng
To Go.translation: I like to go to the cinema to see new movies.

To Go.chinese: 你喜欢去图书馆看书吗？
To Go.pinyin: nǐ xǐhuan qù túshū guǎn kàn shū ma?
To Go.translation: Would you like to go to the library to read books?

To Go.chinese: 他们喜欢去游泳池游泳。
To Go.translation: They like to go to the pool to swim.

To Go.chinese: 他们喜不喜欢去市场买菜
To Go.pinyin: tāmen xǐ bù xǐhuan qù shìchǎng mǎi cài
To Go.translation: Do they like to go to the market to buy food?

Yao (Definition 2).translation: He is going to go to sleep.
I am going to the library.
Because I want to learn Chinese.

Yao (Definition 2).pinyin: wǒ de nǚ péngyǒu yào huí jiā.
Yao (Definition 2).translation: My girlfriend wants to go return home.
The teacher wants to/is going to read.
Mr. Wang is going to go and watch a ball game.

Yao (Definition 3) and Review.translation: I am going to go to the beach.
I want to/am going to/must eat.
You want to/am going to/must buy something.
We want to/are going to/must exercise.
You are going back to China.
They are going to go to work.
What are you going to do?

Adverbs.chinese: 因为我太累，所以我不要出去
Adverbs.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒ tài lèi, suǒyǐ wǒ bùyào chūqù
Adverbs.translation: Because I was too tired, I didn't go out

Adverbs.chinese: 因为天气超热所以他要吃冰淇淋
Adverbs.pinyin: yīn wéi tiānqì chāo rè suǒyǐ tā yào chī bīngqílín
Adverbs.translation: Because the weather was super hot, he wanted to eat ice cream.

Adverbs.chinese: 因为我的狗蛮臭， 所以大家不喜欢它
Adverbs.pinyin: Yīnwèi wǒ de gǒu mán chòu, suǒyǐ dàjiā bù xǐhuan tā
Adverbs.translation: Because my dog is quite smelly, everyone doesn't like it.

Keyi.translation: May I go to the bathroom?

Keyi.pinyin: nǐ kěyǐ gěi wǒ X ma?

Neng.translation: You can go to the bathroom.

Neng.pinyin: nǐ néng bùnéng gěi wǒ bǐ?
Neng.translation: Are you able to give me the pen?

Neng.chinese: 因为我不能去学校，所以我不高兴。
Neng.pinyin: yīnwèi wǒ bùnéng qù xuéxiào, suǒyǐ wǒ bù gāoxìng.
Neng.translation: Because I am not able to go to school, I am not happy.
I am not able to go to China.
My mother is not able to drink alcohol.

Neng.pinyin: wǒ de nǚ'ér hái bùnéng gōngzuò
Neng.translation: My daughter is not able to work.

Neng.chinese: 我的儿子还不能去夜店
Neng.pinyin: wǒ de ér zǐ huán bùnéng qù yèdiàn
Neng.translation: My son cannot go to nightclubs.
I am not able to go out.

Negative Commands.translation: We are going to the airport.

Negative Commands.pinyin: bù yāo mǎi tài guì de jū zi.
Negative Commands.translation: Don't buy a too expensive car.

Mei You.translation: She does not like to go to the library.
You guys don't have English books.
No. I don't have a camera.

Review of You.pinyin: nǐ de māmā yǒu méiyǒu chá?

Review of You.translation: They are not going to the park.

Hen Duo.translation: I have a lot of pandas.
I have a lot of shoes.
You have a lot of money.
She has a lot of books.
We have a lot of friends.
You guys have a lot of pens.
They have a lot of flowers.

Hen Duo.chinese: 我的爸爸没有很多帽子。
Hen Duo.pinyin: wǒ de bàba méiyǒu hěnduō màozi.
Hen Duo.translation: My father does not have many hats.

Hen Duo.chinese: 你的妈妈没有很多椅子。
Hen Duo.pinyin: nǐ de māmā méiyǒu hěnduō yǐzi.
Hen Duo.translation: Your mother does not have many chairs.

Hen Duo.chinese: 我们的老师没有很多学生。
Hen Duo.pinyin: wǒmen de lǎoshī méiyǒu hěnduō xuéshēng.
Hen Duo.translation: Our teacher does not have many students.

How Many and Measure Words.translation: What is the day of the week today?

How Many and Measure Words.pinyin: jīntiān shì jǐ yuè jǐ hào?
How Many and Measure Words.translation: What is the month and date today?
How many younger sisters do you have?
How many students do you have?
How many sisters do you have?
How many brothers does he have?
The restaurant has how many servers?

More Measure Words.pinyin: nǐ de jiā yǒu jǐ gèrén?
More Measure Words.translation: How many people does your home have?

More Measure Words.pinyin: wǒ de jiā yǒu wǔ gèrén.
nǐ de jiā yǒu jǐ zhǐ gǒu?
More Measure Words.translation: How many animals do you have at home?

More Measure Words.pinyin: wǒ de jiā yǒu liǎng zhī gǒu.

More Measure Words.translation: How many books do you have?

More Measure Words.pinyin: nǐ yǒu jǐ gè zhōngguó péngyǒu?
More Measure Words.translation: How many Chinese friends do you have?

More Measure Words.pinyin: Mike lǎoshī yǒu jǐ běn zázhì?
More Measure Words.translation: How many magazines does teacher Mike have?
How many cats does she have?
How many children do they have?

Even More Measure Words.translation: I want to buy a bed.
Give me a piece of paper.

Even More Measure Words.pinyin: nǐ de jiā yǒu jǐ zhāng zhuōzi.
Even More Measure Words.translation: How many tables are in your home?
Do you want a cup of water?
Give me four cups of coffee.
Do you want a bottle of water?
I don't have a piece of paper.
You have two cups of tea.
He has six bottles of cola.
How many glasses of milk do you guys want?
How many horses do they have?

Zhege and Nage.translation: This man is my older brother.
That woman is my older sister.

Zhege and Nage.chinese: 那个男孩（子）是我的弟弟。
Zhege and Nage.pinyin: nàgè nánhái (zi) shì wǒ de dìdì.
Zhege and Nage.translation: That boy is my younger brother.

Zhege and Nage.chinese: 这个孩子是老师的儿子。
Zhege and Nage.pinyin: zhège háizi shì lǎoshī de érzi.
Zhege and Nage.translation: This child is the teachers son.
That guyyoung man is a college student.
That girlyoung woman is a high school student.

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.translation: This cup of coffee is very hot.

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.pinyin: zhè běn shū shì shuí de.

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.chinese: 这个女人是你的妈妈吗？
Zhe and Na and Measure Words.pinyin: zhège nǚrén shì nǐ de māmā ma?
zhè zhāng zhǐ shì shuí de?
Zhe and Na and Measure Words.translation: Whose piece of paper is this?

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.pinyin: nà zhāng chuáng hěn shūfú ma?
zhè bēi guǒzhī hǎo hē ma?
Zhe and Na and Measure Words.translation: Is this cup of fruit juice good to drink?

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.pinyin: nà bēi chá shì shuí de?
Zhe and Na and Measure Words.translation: Whose cup of tea is that?

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.pinyin: zhè běn zázhì hěn guì ma?

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.translation: Is that book a good read?

Zhe and Na and Measure Words.chinese: 那只猪是你的女朋友的吗？
Zhe and Na and Measure Words.pinyin: nà zhǐ zhū shì nǐ de nǚ péngyǒu de ma?

Prepositions I.pinyin: wǒ de wòshì zài lóu shàng.

Prepositions II.pinyin: báibǎn bǐ zài wǒ de qiánmiàn.
Prepositions II.translation: The whiteboard marker is in front of me.
The milk is inside the refrigerator.
The coffee is inside the microwave.

Prepositions III.translation: The tree is on my left.
The stairs are next to me.
The stairs are on my left.
The door is next to me.
The door is on my right.
The computer is on the table.

Prepositions III.pinyin: Mike lǎoshī zài diànnǎo de qiánmiàn.
Prepositions III.translation: Mike is in front of the computer.
The flowers are above the chair.
The ball is below the chair.
The bananas are between the chairs.
The vegetables are between the meat.

Prepositions III.chinese: 我很饿。我要去外面烤肉。
Prepositions III.pinyin: Wǒ hěn è. Wǒ yào qù wàimiàn kǎoròu.
Prepositions III.translation: I'm hungry. I'm going outside to barbecue.

Yao vs Xiang I.translation: Do you want to drink something?

Yao vs Xiang I.pinyin: Yīnwèi wǒ yào zuò hěnduō shì.
Yao vs Xiang I.translation: Because I must do many things.

Yao vs. Xiang II.translation: Do you want to drink something?

Yao vs. Xiang II.pinyin: Yīnwèi wǒ yào zuò hěnduō shì.
Yao vs. Xiang II.translation: Because I must do many things.
To want, would like to, think about, to miss
Where are you going to go tomorrow?
I am going to go to school.
Where would you like to go tomorrow?
Tomorrow I want to go to the zoo.

Yao & Xiang III.translation: I am thinking.

Yao & Xiang III.pinyin: wǒ zài xiǎng wǒ de wèilái.
Yao & Xiang III.translation: I am thinking about my future.
Don't think about it too much.
Don't eat too much.
Don't drink too much.

Yao & Xiang III.pinyin: wǒ hěn xiǎng wǒ de māmā.
Yao & Xiang III.translation: I really miss my mother.
Do you miss me?
Yes I do. I miss you.
I am homesick.
I want to eat beef.
I would like to eat beef.

Yao & Xiang III.pinyin: wǒ xiǎng diǎn yī wǎn tāng.
Yao & Xiang III.translation: I would like a bowl of soup.

Yao & Xiang III.pinyin: tā xiǎng diǎn yī fèn chūnjuǎn.
Yao & Xiang III.translation: I would like to order a portion of spring rolls.

Yao & Xiang III.pinyin: nǐ xiǎng qù kāfēi tīng ma?
Yao & Xiang III.translation: Do you want to go to the cafe?
Yes. I would like to go.

Yao & Xiang III.chinese: 他们想不想来我们(的)家？
Yao & Xiang III.pinyin: tāmen xiǎng bùxiǎng lái wǒmen (de) jiā?
Yao & Xiang III.translation: Would they like to come to our home?
I am going to go to China next year.
I would like to go to the UK next year.
I must work tomorrow.
I would like to go to a movie tomorrow.

There is & There are.translation: To have, there is, there are
How many people are in your home?
There are 5 people in my family.

There is & There are.pinyin: nǐ jiā yǒu jǐ tái diànshì?
There is & There are.translation: How many TVs does your home have?
My home has three of them.

There is & There are.pinyin: nǐ de bān yǒu jǐ gè xuéshēng?
There is & There are.translation: How many students are there in your class.

There is & There are.pinyin: wǒ de bān yǒu shí gè xuéshēng.

There is & There are.translation: The US has how many states?

There is & There are.pinyin: zhuōzi de shàngmiàn yǒu jīběn shū?
There is & There are.translation: How many books are on the table?

There is & There are.pinyin: zhuōzi de shàngmiàn yǒu sì běn shū.
There is & There are.translation: There are four books on the table.

There is & There are.pinyin: yǐzi xiàmiàn yǒu jǐ zhǐ bǐ?
There is & There are.translation: How many pens are under the chair?

There is & There are.pinyin: yǐzi de xiàmiàn yǒu bā zhǐ (bǐ).
There is & There are.translation: There are 8 pens under the chair.

There is & There are.pinyin: bīngxiāng de lǐmiàn yǒu jǐ píng shuǐ?
There is & There are.translation: How many bottles of water are in the fridge?

There is & There are.pinyin: bīngxiāng de lǐmiàn yǒu liǎng píng (shuǐ)
There is & There are.translation: There are two bottles in the fridge.

There is & There are.pinyin: Mike lǎoshī de pángbiān yǒu jǐ kē qiú?
There is & There are.translation: How many balls are beside Teacher Mike?

There is & There are.pinyin: Mike lǎoshī de pángbiān yǒuyī kē (qiú).
There is & There are.translation: There is one ball next to Teacher Mike.

Present Progressive.pinyin: wǒmen zài kàn Chinese With Mike.
Present Progressive.translation: We are watching Chinese With Mike.
What is your younger sister doing?

More Present Progressive.pinyin: wǒmen zài děng wǒmen de péngyǒu.
More Present Progressive.translation: We are waiting for our friends.

More Present Progressive.chinese: 他们的妈妈再吃什么水果？
More Present Progressive.pinyin: tāmen de māmā zài chī shénme shuǐguǒ?
More Present Progressive.translation: What fruit is their mum eating?

More Present Progressive.pinyin: tā xǐhuan chī hěn tián de cǎoméi.
More Present Progressive.translation: She likes to eat sweet strawberries.

Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.translation: Do you want to rent a place?
Yes. I want to rent a place.
No. I don't want to rent a place.

Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.pinyin: nǐ de péngyǒu huì shuō zhōngwén ma?
nǐ de péngyǒu huì bù huì zhōngwén?
huì. Wǒ de péngyǒu huì shuō zhōngwén.
Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.translation: Yes. My friend can speak Chinese.

Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.chinese: 不会。我的朋友不会中文。
Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.pinyin: bù huì. Wǒ de péngyǒu bù huì zhōngwén.
Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.translation: No. My friend can't speak Chinese.

Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.pinyin: bù xǐhuan. Wǒ bù xǐhuan kàn shū.

Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.translation: Would you like to go to London?
Yes. I would like to go to London.
No. I would not like to go to London.
Yes. He is at the restaurant.

Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.pinyin: bù zài. Tā bù zài cāntīng.
Yes-No Question Review and Farewell!.translation: No. He is not at the restaurant.
No. I am eating fried rice.
